note.p: Independent nonconformist minister and religious writer. Resident at Pond House (later renamed Tromer Lodge), Down, 1845–58. Minister of New Court Chapel, Carey Street, London. Secretary of the London City Mission and of the Congregational Board of Education. Minister of Christ Church (non-sectarian), Brighton, 1860–74.
Correspondence vol. 3, letter to Susan Darwin, 3[–4] September 1845
England & Wales, non-conformist and non-parochial registers, 1567–1970 (Ancestry.com, accessed 27 February 2020)
letter from O. A. Ainslie, 23 November 1880
letter from Emma Darwin to W. E. Darwin, [October 1858] (DAR 210.6: 26)
